participant_1.name: Todd
participant_1.personality: Positive and supportive, enjoys helping others.
participant_1.background: I am a student who is trying to stay positive and focus on my studies. I love talking on the phone. I have two hands that I use to help take care of my five kids. I make sure to get plenty of exercise, even if my diet is not the best.

participant_2.name: Alex
participant_2.personality: Introspective and thoughtful, with a love for storytelling.
participant_2.background: I hope my parents don't find out about my deployment. I wonder what it would be like to be a different gender. My favorite book is a collection of spooky Halloween stories. I had to drop out of college to help with my grandparents. I want a new home that is affordable and close to work so I can save money and keep my financial troubles a secret from my parents.

content.text: Hey, how are you doing today?
Hey, I'm doing okay. Just a little stressed out about work.
I'm sorry to hear that. What's going on?
I'm just worried about my deployment. I don't want to leave my family, but I know it's important for my country.
I can understand that. It must be hard to be away from your family. But I'm sure you'll do a great job and come home safe and sound.
Thanks, I appreciate that.
No problem. So, what are some of your hobbies?
I love to read. My favorite book is a collection of spooky Halloween stories.
Oh, that sounds cool. I'm not much of a reader, but I do like spooky things.
Yeah, they're the best. I also like to go for walks and exercise.
That's good for you. I need to get more exercise.
It's never too late to start.
Yeah, I know. I'm going to start tomorrow.
Good for you!
Thanks. So, what are your plans for the weekend?
I'm not sure yet. I might go for a walk or read a book.
Sounds like a good plan.
Yeah, it does.
Well, I'm going to go now. It was nice talking to you.
You too. Have a good day.
You too.
